content:
**Which graph shows an exponential function with a domain of $-6 < x \leq 8$?**


[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A segment of an exponential function is graphed. The x and g of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. The curve ends on the left side in a filled circle at (negative 5, 8) and ends on the right side in an open, unfilled circle at (7, -6).](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/fdeb6e0afbcaa9fa52e3571f2b17a40f9e4c5ba3)

![A segment of an exponential function is graphed. The x and g of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. The curve ends on the left side in an open, unfilled circle at (negative 5, 8) and ends on the right side in a filled circle at (7, -6).](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/39502c69e176043c4487cc28ce43afe59b463e41)

![A segment of an exponential function is graphed. The x and g of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. The curve ends on the left side in a filled circle at (negative 6, 8) and ends on the right side in an open, unfilled circle at (8, 0 point 5).](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/6e3385a10ba51af7a90b0d72e7f50c8952721657)

![A segment of an exponential function is graphed. The x and g of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. The curve ends on the left side in an open, unfilled circle at (negative 6, 8) and ends on the right side in a filled circle at (8, 0 point 5).](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/3e0d5dd0fe610f3410166341f60f6f18b526bb8b)
